Her husband sells animals. He buys goats, sheep, buffalo when they are young, grows them up and sells them to butchers for profits.
Sabran is very supportive. In her spare time, she provides full support to her husband by taking care of animals.
She has given birth to five sons and two daughters. Her eldest son left his education and started an electrician business. Her remaining children are continuing their education.
Sabran has applied for a loan for her family business of selling animals. With the loan investment, her husband will buy a buffalo that will allow him to earn more profits. He will also sell its milk for profits.
He has been operating his business since his he was a teenager and Sabran is hopeful that an investment will be a more productive one for him.

loans.use: buy a buffalo for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur and industrious woman. She is 38 years old and married to Alberto who is a carpenter within her local community of Villamor Cabarroguis. The couple have been blessed with four children and three of them are still studying and one is still an infant. Myrna has been married since 1994. After two years they have been able to start their manufacturing business where they sell different kinds of furniture.

Myrna is grateful because of the continuous improvement of her furniture business. Though there has been improvement with her business she still would like to borrow additional working capital due to the high cost of the raw woods and varnish. She is applying for a loan amounting to P25,000 to be able to pay for her order of raw wood and varnish from her contact person. According to her, the family's income goes to their daily needs, allowances of children and payment for their monthly electric bill. With the loan amount she is requesting, she would be able to increase her sales and satisfy her costumers' demand. In addition, she could encourage more costumers to buy her finished products. In this way, she could gain higher income and promote her products to other places. If these things happen, then she could support her children's education until they finish their studies.

loans.use: purchase varnish and raw woods for her manufacturing business.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a mother who has the determination to become successful in the future. She is 47 years old and has three children. Two of the children are still studying in secondary and tertiary level. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Juvy aims to improve her variety store in order to increase her income and satisfy their necessities and support the schooling of their children. 

To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of P11,000 to buy rice, soft drinks, fish, vegetables, noodles, beverages and junk food to sell. She mentioned that the loan will be a great help for her to increase her product offerings and to satisfy her customers demand. She hopes that she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, fish, vegetables, noodles, beverages and junk food to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 53 years of age, married and manages a rice farm within her village. She and her husband work together to experience a comfortable way of living and saving for their child. They are preparing for their child's college education. Both of them wish to see their child become a degree holder someday.

With regards to her business, she wants to develop more in order to achieve better crops. She is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers and insecticides to use in rice farming. She promises to work harder to attain all of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers and insecticides to use in rice farming.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra supports her family by selling clothes. She has a good name among her community clients due to her good quality products and services. 
Her husband is an animal seller and sells animals to butchers and other people. Bushra is the mother of three sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy a buffalo that will allow him to earn more profits by selling its milk and also by selling it later.
Bushra has a lot of confidence in her husband. She is very much sure that he will successfully be able to improve his business after the loan investment.

loans.use: buy a buffalo for her husband's animals sales business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has owned a furniture shop since 1997. She is 46 years of age and is married to Marlon who is a carpenter. The couple are blessed with three children. Two of her children are already married and living separately with their own families while the youngest is helping the family in their manufacturing business.

Grace makes general household furniture and sells it to local their community. According to her, she is able to earn about P20,000 a month. She uses her income to meet the family's daily needs, pay the salaries of hired laborers and pay for her monthly electric bill. Grace plans to buy stocks of raw materials to minimize her expenses in going to and from the market and to improve the quality of her finish furniture products. With her determination to obtain greater profits she is requesting a loan amounting to P25,000.  

The purpose of the loan is to purchase raw materials such as woods, nails, varnish and wood glue for her furniture business. She is hoping that she can maintain her business and improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood, nails, varnish and wood glue for her furniture business.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is 41 years of age, married and blessed with three responsible children. The major source of livelihood in their village is farming. Rolly also works as a farmer. He learned to farm from his parents who also owned a farm. Right now, he is also getting his children used this business and he is earns 9,000 pesos every harvest cropping. His income is not enough to meet all the needs of his family, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farming business. He hopes that someday he can make abundant income and sustain the needs of his family in order to avoid difficulties.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine and will also hire a worker that will allow her to finish the orders on time and increase her profits.
She is a very active and efficient lady. She also performs her household duties very well along with her business.
She is married and has 2 sons and a daughter. All of her children are enrolled in local schools and are getting their education.
Her husband operates a furniture manufacturing and selling business. He is very skillful and makes different kinds of furniture such as doors, tables, chairs on order.
Yasmeen is confident that a loan investment will help her get more success for her business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 31 years of age and has a stall in the market selling clothes. She has been operating this stall for one year. She learned the trade from her friends who fruitfully achieved success. She wants to similar accomplishments, so she is asking a loan of P15,000 to buy casual dresses, pants, shirts and blouses as additional goods to offer. She is investing more merchandise to make high sales and earn high income. 

She is preparing for the education of her four children and for the development of their living situation. Hopefully she can lift up her business and operate forwardly.

loans.use: to buy casual dresses, pants, shirts and blouses as additional goods to offer in her store.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is 35 years old, married and a mother of 6 children. Her eldest son works in the court while others are studying in local schools except the youngest daughter who is only 3 years of age.
Salma is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month.
Her husband sells animals. He purchases buffalos and then sells for profit.
Salma has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who will buy a buffalo to later sell and earn profits on the buffalo's milk in the meantime.
He has been operating his business for many years and Salma is very confident that a loan investment will help him earn more profits from his business.

loans.use: To buy buffalo for her husband's animal sales business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 58 years old and has three adult children. Despite being widowed, he continuously manages the family's rice farming business to earn a living. Due to financial difficulties, he also engages in furniture making to generate additional income. He has been in this business for almost six years and usually earns a profits of P7,000 monthly. He utilizes his income for their daily living and saves for future emergencies.

He aims to strengthen his furniture making business to make it viable source of income. He is asking for additional capital of P7,000 to buy woods, screws, nails, varnish and paints needed in furniture making. He believes that he will be able to improve the business if he continues working hard and manages his business well. He is hoping that someday, his business will grow and his family's status of living will improve.

loans.use: to buy woods, screws, nails, varnish and paints needed in furniture making.

loans.name: Maqboolan's Group

texts.en:
Maqboolan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s snacks selling business.
With the loan investment, he will buy snack making ingredients such as cooking oil, spices, etc in larger quantity that will allow him to make better quality snacks and increase his sales and profits.
Maqboolan is hopeful that an investment will help her husband earn more profits from his business by utilizing the loan in positive way.
Maqboolan herself is also a working lady and she operates a grocery store at her home through which she offers grocery items to her clients for low rates.
In her spare time she also sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns a reasonable amount of income.
She is the mother of four sons and a daughter. All of her children are enrolled in local schools and are getting their education. 
She is hopeful that her children will be able to continue their education as a result of her husband’s better business conditions after receiving the loan investment.
Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Maqboolan."

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, spices, etc for her husband's snack making and selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, gingers, cabbages, eggplants and bitter melons to sell.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a very active lady and performs her household duties very well. She has applied for a loan for her husband’s business that sells snacks. He uses very good quality ingredients in his snacks and that is why the snacks sell so well and for a good price. Sajida helps her husband prepare snacks in her spare time.
With the loan investment, her husband will buy snack making ingredients such as spices and cooking oil in larger quantity that will allow him to make snacks of better taste and increase his sales and profits.
He has been operating his business for many years and Sajida is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and increase his income.
Sajida is the mother of three children. She is only able to educate her eldest son who is in the 2nd grade. She is hopeful that by improving her husband’s business, she will be able to provide education to her remaining children.
Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book (Called Asasah Passbook) is Sajida."

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, spices etc for her husband's snack selling business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 38 years old and has two school-aged children. They live happily in a village planting and harvesting vegetables, corn and fruits for sale. Despite financial difficulty, her and her husband have the determination to continue sending their children to school because both her husband and Norma want their children to become professionals in the future. She is engaged in selling fruits and vegetables to help her husband gain income.

She aims to acquire more vegetables to sell but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional P8,000 to buy beans, tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflowers, cabbages, onions and eggplants to sell. She believes that she can improve her business and increase her income as she continues to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy beans, tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflowers, cabbages, onions and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Jun

texts.en:
Despite the hardship of living, Jun has the determination to uplift his family's living status and give his family a better future. He is now 49 years old and has three school-age children. Together with his wife, they plan to improve their sources of living and support the education of their children. Due to financial difficulty though, he engages in hog-raising to earn additional income.

He is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in raising hogs. He mentioned that the loan will be a great help for him to improve his business and he hopes that the loan will make his business grow in the future to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in raising hogs.

loans.name: Ségbognalé

texts.fr:
Ségbognalé est un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est marié à une couturière et a 01 enfant.  
Ségbognalé travaille comme revendeur de cartes de recharges depuis 2009. Il vend à toute personne dans un quartier de la place et achète à Togocellulaire(société de distribution de cartes). Il vend seul et n’a aucune difficulté.
Ségbognalé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de cartes de recharges. Il réinvestir afin d’avoir de bénéfices et pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ségbognalé is a twenty-seven year old man. He is married to a seamstress and has one child.
Ségbognalé has worked as a reseller of phone recharge cards since 2009. He sells to anyone in an area of the plaza and buys at Togocellulaire (a company that distributes cards). He sells alone and has no difficulty.
Ségbognalé requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy more recharge cards. He is going to reinvest in order to have earnings and to better take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Chancelle Orlec Suresness

texts.fr:
Cliente de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varient entre 2 a 8 ans. Elle se lance das la vente de la friperie a l'obtention de son Bac et ne  voulant pas continuer des etudes universitaires  a cause du manque de moyen .
Elle  a deja bénéficie d'un prêt a Hope, elle vient de finir de  rembourser avec succès , elle a fait des épargnes considérables, pour vouloir atteindre ses objectifs, elle ne compte pas s'arrêter , elle va prendre un second prêt pour renforcer son activité en achetant encore des vestes , des ensembles hommes , des chemises et des pantalons en kaki et en jeans.
Elle a témoigné de l'impact que le crédit a eu a créer dans sa vie, a l'heure actuelle , elle ne prend plus en bon chez les grossistes , elle achète 2 a 3 ballots cash et en vendant elle a une grande bénéfice. 
 Tres engagée, elle tient a aller loin continuer a prendre les prêts, jusqu'à ce qu'elle atteigne ses objectifs , ouvrir une boutique d'habits des vêtements.
texts.en:
The client is thirty-three years old, married, and mother of two children aged between two and eight years. She is starting out in second-hand clothing sales, after having obtained her high school diploma and not wanting to continue with university studies because of a lack of means.
She has already benefited from a loan from HOPE, which she has just successfully repaid. She made considerable savings, to attain her objectives she doesn't count on stopping, and she is going to take out a second loan to reinforce her activity in buying even more jackets, men's suits, blouses, khaki pants and jeans.
She has shown the impact that the loan had in her life: Right now, she doesn't buy her stock from the wholesaler anymore, she buys two or three bundles in cash and in selling them she makes a large profit.
Very committed, she wants to go far and continue to take out loans until she can attain her goal, to open a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy bales of outfits, jackets, and men's pants

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Oumou est une femme âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un  revendeur. Elle a 06 enfants, dont 05 à l’école. Le premier a 19 ans et le dernier a 6mois. 
Oumou travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 2000. Elle vend à la maison et des fois dans un marché de la place à ses clients. Elle vend seule et n’a pas de difficulté principale.
Oumou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Oumou voudrait faire prospérer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Oumou, 34, is married to a retailer. She has 6 children, 5 of whom go to school. The eldest is 19 and the youngest is 6 months old.
Oumou has been selling cereals since 2000. She does so at home and sometimes at a market at the public square. She works by herself and knows no major difficulty.
Oumou is applying for a first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals. She wants to reinvest in this business.
In the coming years, Oumou would like to see her business grow. She says that, with the profit, she wishes for her family to thrive.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr:
Cette cliente est âgée de 52 ans, divorcée et mère de Quatre enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 18 ans et 32 ans. Avec son premier crédit la cliente a renforcé son activité en achetant les cartons de poissons salés. Ses ventes ont  augmentés, elle encaisse en moyenne 35 000 à 60 000 F par jour. 
Avec ce deuxième crédit,  la cliente va agrandir son activité en ouvrant un autre dépôt de poissons salés où elle va vendre sa marchandise en gros, ainsi elle va acheter : 20 cartons de thons, 15 cartons de  Maquerelles, 15 cartons de poissons salés de morue, 10 cartons de poissons salés de corvinas
Avec un bon accueil des clients et une grande publicité, cette cliente à une bonne réputation dans le marché, ce qui a entrainer une croissance de sa  clientèle  au cours de ces quatre derniers mois.
Avec les bénéfices de ses ventes, elle a commencé les travaux de construction de sa parcelle.
texts.en:
This client is 52 years old, divorced, and mother of four children between the ages of 18 and 32. With her first loan, she strengthened her business by buying boxes of salted fish. Her sales have increased, and on average she makes between 35,000 and 60,000 F per day.

With this second loan, she is going to expand her business by opening another warehouse where she will sell salted fish wholesale. Thus, she will buy: 20 boxes of tuna, 15 boxes of mackerel, 15 boxes of cod, and 10 boxes of corbina. She is very well-known, and has a good reputation at the market as being very accommodating to her customers. Consequently, she has seen her customer base grow over the past four months.

With the profits from her sales, she has begun construction work on her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy boxes of salted fish, such as 'flechard', mackerel, cod, tuna, and corbina.

loans.name: Koboyodou

texts.fr:
Koboyodou est une femme  âgé(e) de 41 ans. Elle est mariée à un gendarme  et a 01 enfant.
Koboyodou travaille comme revendeuse de la boisson locale depuis 2004. Elle vend seule dans un quartier de la place et achète les matières premières dans le Nord du pays.
Koboyodou a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du sorgho pour la préparation de la boisson.
texts.en:
Koboyodou is a 41-year-old woman. She is married to a policeman and has one child.

Since 2004 Koboyodou has been working as a seller of the local beverage. She works by herself and sells the product in a neighborhood around the town square. She buys the raw materials in the northern region of the country.

Koboyodou is asking for a second loan from WAGES in order to buy sorghum for the preparation of the beverage.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Yao est un homme âgé de 22 ans. Il est marié à une couturière et ont ensemble 02 enfants.
Yao travaille comme photographe et caméraman depuis 2005. Il a un atelier dans un quartier de la place dans lequel il sert ses clients.
Yao a requis son crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 01 appareil photo,01 imprimante,01 appareil numérique et autres.
texts.en:
Yao is a 22 year-old man. He is married to a seamstress, with whom he has two kids.

Yao has been working as a photographer and cameraman since 2005. He has a workshop in the locality in which he works for his customers.

Yao requested a loan from WAGES to purchase a camera, a printer, a digital camera and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy photo supplies.

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr:
Akuvi est une femme  âgé(e) de 35ans. Elle est mariée å un  revendeur. Elle a 01enfant.
Akuvi travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2002. Elle vend les condiments, ignames et autres à Lomé et répond à la demande de la population dans un bar. Elle est aidée par 15 employés et n’a pas de difficultés principales.
Akuvi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames, des condiments et autres. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en:
Akuvi, 35, is married to a retailer. She has 1 child.
She has been working as a restaurateur since 2002. She sells condiments and yams, amongst other things, in a bar in Lomé. She has 15 employees and her business knows no major difficulties.
Akuvi is applying for a second loan from WAGES in order to buy yams, condiments, and other things. She wants to reinvest in her business and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy yams, condiments, and other things.

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
A mother of six children in a village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia, Saren is now 43 years old. Two of her children are still in school while the other four are married. Crop farming is the main source of income for her family. She has grown maize and cassava on her farmland for nearly 30 years. 

Saren and her group member Leang have joined with VisionFund since 2010 and the loan has helped her make a better living. She leads this group in applying for another loan with VisionFund for US$300 each. She wants to use the entire loan to buy maize seeds, cassava seedling and fertilizer for her farmland. This loan will enable her to increase her family’s income and buy nutrient food.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds, cassava seedling and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Hav's Group

texts.en:
A breadwinner of the family residing in a village of the Moung Russey district, Hav is 24 years old and has two sons who are too young to attend school. She is a farmer who has been farming rice on her own farmland as her only income source for nearly ten years. 

Hav received a loan from VisionFund four years ago. Since 2007, the loans have helped her grow her rice timely to feed her family. With her current income of six U.S. dollars per day, she successfully repaid her last loan with VisionFund. Now she leads a group consisting of three female members who have been with VisionFund for two to four years. As the leader, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland for US$350. She hopes to increase her crop yield and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for farmland.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en: Ayda is a 46 years old woman, she is married with three sons and two daughters. Her husband has a stall for selling vegetables. This business provides low income, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. Ayda wants to paint her house, so she is requesting a 1,100 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing the materials and tools needed to paint the house. This will improve the family's house condition for the better. Ayda is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: to pay the expenses for painting the house.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
A breadwinner of the family residing in a village of the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common business activity, Thea is 42 years old and has four children: one daughter and three sons. All of her children are still in school. Like other villagers, Thea is also a rice farmer who has been farming her own farmland as a primary business for 15 years while her husband is a house builder in the area.

Thea has joined with VisionFund since 2008. The previous loans have helped her grow her rice timely and successfully and send her children to school regularly. With her current income of nine U.S. dollars per day, she is able to save three U.S. dollars daily for future needs. Successfully repaying her last loan with VisionFund, she leads a group consisting of three female members in applying for another loan with VisionFund for US$350 each. As the leader, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Vibol's Group

texts.en:
A widow from a village of the Ponhea Krek distric, Vibol is 43 years old and has three dependent children who are still in school. She is a peasant in the village who has been farming cassava for a living for the last twenty years. To better feed her children and support their education, she has struggled to earn a living by selling rice soup and Khmer noodle in the village. With her current business, Vibol earns around US$5 per day and she is able to set aside four U.S. dollars daily. 

With a lack of money for her cassava business, Vibol and her group member Kimheng are requesting their first group loan with VisionFund for US$250 each. As the leader, she wants to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland for US$250. She hopes to grow her cassava healthfully and gain more yields to earn more income to better feed her children and support her children’s education. She also hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a village of the Ponhea Krek district, Nan is a 23 year-old mother of two dependent children. Only one of them is still at school. She and her husband Eam are farmers. To better make a living, Nan raises pigs while her husband works for others to raise extra income. She has been in the rice farming and pig raising business for nine years and one half year, respectively. Now she earns less than US$5 per day and is able to set aside about two U.S. dollars daily. 

This is Nan’s first group loan with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of two members. Now requesting a loan, she will use this entire loan of KHR1,000,000 to buy piglets and feed for her pigs. She hopes to feed her pigs to be fat and healthy and she also hopes to earn good profit from this business in order to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed for her pigs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Montaser

texts.en: Montaser who is a 30 years old young man, is married with two sons and two daughters. He has a butcher shop, which is a success and profitable project, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs. Montaser wants to purchase a number of sheep to sell, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving his butcher shop. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Montaser is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for sale.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district where crop farming is common, Soeng is now 46 years old. She is a rice farmer and also plants cassava. She has been in this business earning a living for more than ten years. Moreover, she raises pigs to gain additional income. Soeng has four children, three of whom are dependents and work for others for a fee. 

Soeng received a loan with VisionFund three years ago. The loans have helped her have regular income and make a living better. She earns around fourteen U.S. dollars per day. Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice paddy. She hopes to make more rice and earn more income to set aside in order to buy rice for sale and buy more piglets.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice paddy.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 44 years old and a father with one daughter. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past 2 years, he has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Khaled is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Khaled is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and improve the herd's condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water tanks and water containers

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 37 years old; he is married and has three children. To earn a living, he sells second-hand shoes. He has been in the business for eight ears and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business because he has been trained in business management skills. Michael hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand shoes.

loans.use: To buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Cleotilde

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Cleotilde, es casada, tiene 28 años de edad, se dedica al bordado de blusas y güipiles, cursó los tres años de educación básica, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, inició este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus familiares y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica ala panadería.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de hilos de alta seda en diferente colores y adornos para bordados de güipiles y blusas, espera en el futuro tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Sandra Cleotilde is 28 years old and married.  She works embroidering shirts and traditional tunics.  She went to school for three years.  She has two children who are in school. 

She started her business with her family's support and now has four years of experience.  She also has her husband's support, who works as a baker.

She is asking for this loan to purchase silk thread in different colors and trims to embroider traditional tunics and blouses.  She hopes in the future to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn dreams of lifting her family out of poverty. She is 32 years old. In the year 1999, Rovelyn married Glen, a farmer in their village. Rovelyn operates a small store in which she sells different products. She has been in this business for three years and usually earns 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) a day. Profits earned are used for allowances and food, and serves as revolving capital in the business. 

Rovelyn's business needs additional products to sell in order to increase profits. Thus, she is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, bakery bread, sugar, coffee and other ingredients to sell.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bakery bread, sugar, coffee and other ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is 41 years of age. She is married to Rolando. The couple is thankful because they had been blessed with two children. Their family lives in the village of San Francisco. Jenneth has had a retail store in their village for over eight years. Her net income daily is 300 PHP. 

Due to insufficient capital, she's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional stock items such as canned goods, noodles, bread, curls and soft drinks to sell. The business has been a great help in developing her family's living conditions. Jenneth, would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock items such as canned goods, noodles, bread, culs and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 41 years old, married and has four children.  For five years, he has been selling charcoal to earn a living.  Besides that,he runs a greengrocery and does photography.  He has witnessed a lot of growth since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because has been able to access business loans easily.

Alex wants to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy more charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 48 years old and is married. She has nine children, some of whom are already married. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a general store in the village of Loria. She has been in this business for five years. She usually earns about PHP 9,000 monthly. 

As of now, Elvira wants to expand her business, thus she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, curls, candies and soft drinks to sell in her village. The profits earned are used for allowances and food, and serves as revolving capital in the business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, curls, candies and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 27 years old and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace has operated her rolling store business for two years. She earns about P250 daily by patiently operating her business. Mary Grace wants to expand her venture, and that is why she is taking out this loan amounting to P8,000 to purchase vegetables such as eggplant, string beans, squash, garlic and union to sell. She hopes to further grow her business to secure her family's future. She is also aiming to give her children a better education so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, she strives hard to earn and save for family's progress.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as eggplant, string beans, squash, garlic and union to sell.

loans.name: Crisencia

texts.en: Crisencia is 48 years old. She is from the village of Loria in the town of Angadanan. She is married and blessed with four children. Crisencia is engaged in a food production business. She usually sells street food such as egg "kwew-kwek" and hot dogs. Crisencia is now asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy ingredients for her business such as vinegar, salt, pork, egg, and hot dogs to sell. She would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as vinegar, salt, pork, egg, and hot dogs to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is willing to work hard to lift her family out of poverty. To make a living, Angelita sells different kinds of vegetables. She earns about PHP 1,500 per week. She has been in this business for more than two years. She is now already 53 years old, married and has five children. She is thankful, because through her business she is able to provide the needs of her family and aid the growth of her business.

At this moment, Angelita is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to acquire different kinds of vegetables such as string beans, squash, potatoes and eggplants to sell. She dreams of seeing her business grow, having a good estate to leave her children, good economic stability and quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire different kinds of vegetables such as string beans, squash, potatoes and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Aqeela

texts.en:
Aqeela is very supportive in nature. She works full time with her husband in operating a pranda making business. Pranda is a traditional product which is used to tie-up women's hair. It is very popular among women and has great demand in the country. Her husband collects the orders and supplies prandas in the market while Aqeela makes prandas to fulfill those orders by working from her home. She is the mother of 4 children. All of them are enrolled in local schools and are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah which she will utilize in her pranda making business. She will use better quality material such as beads, silk, thread etc in her prandas that will allow her to earn more profits from her business by selling them in higher quantity and for better prices.
She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident about her success in business once she invests the loan.

loans.use: To buy beads, threads, silk etc for pranda making business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business of making shoe uppers.
It is actually her family business and Safia, her husband and her four children all work together to make their living expenses. Her two younger daughters are less then 10 years of age and stay at home.
With the loan investment, her husband will buy leather, shoe laces and tools for making better quality shoe uppers that will be sold for higher profits.
Safia is very much hopeful that a loan investment will help her family's business to grow and as a result her family will be able to live a better financial life.

loans.use: To buy leather and laces for her husband's shoe upper making business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her pranda making and selling business. Pranda is a traditional product which is used to tie-up women's hair. It is very popular with women and has great demand in the country.
With the loan investment, she will buy raw material such as thread, beads etc in larger quantity that will allow her to make larger quantity prandas and earn higher profits by selling them.
She is very skillful and has a lot of experience in her field of work. She is confident that she will get more success in her business after investing the loan.
Her husband is a cobbler and an expert in making shoes. He has a great number of business contacts and receives orders regularly from his clients.
Halima has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her sons work with their father in his business while her daughter supports Halima in completing the pranda making orders.
Halima and her family are working very hard to afford their living expenses and Halima is confident that a loan investment will help her make better profits and her family’s living standard will further improve.

loans.use: To buy thread, beads and other material for Pranda making business.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen has requesting loan from KIVA partner Asasah for husband’s shoe soul stitching business. He is very experienced in his work and has been operating it for many years.
With the loan investment, he will buy leather and other raw materials in larger quantity. He will also repair his machine that will allow him to do his work better.
Perveen is a housewife. She stays at her home and does her household responsibilities. In her spare time she also provides full support to her husband by preparing shoe uppers.
She has given birth to three daughters and a son. She couldn’t educate them due to financial constraints. All of her children help Perveen and her husband in preparing shoe uppers.
Perveen’s family is very hardworking. She is very confident that by utilizing the loan, her family's business will be improved and her family will be able to live a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy leather and other raw material for her husband's shoe sole stitching business.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida believes that through patience and hard work her family will survive poverty. She is a hard-working mother who is engaged in a food vending business. Because of the high costs of basic commodities, Florida aims to improve her small business to satisfy her family's basic necessities.
 
She cooks and sells different kinds of snacks in the village, but her capital is not sufficient to acquire the needed ingredients to cook. Therefore, she is asking a loan for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy flour, oil, coconut and sugar to cook "puto" and native cakes to sell in the village.
 
She mentioned that this loan will help make the business grow as she continues to work and strive harder. In the future, she hopes that she will improve the business and put up her own food stall near the school campus.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, coconut and sugar to cook "puto" and native cakes that she will sell in the village.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is 36 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a cobbler and makes shoes on order. Due to his good quality work, his shoes have high demand in the market.
Safina is very supportive. In order to financially support her husband, she makes prandas. Pranda is a traditional product which is used to tie-up women's hair. She is very skilful in her work and receives a good number of orders every month.
Her children also support her. Except the youngest one, her remaining three children go to school in the morning and after coming back, they help Safina complete the pranda orders.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s shoe making business. With the loan investment, he will buy shoe making material such as leather, shoe laces etc in larger quantity and of better quality that will allow him to make more profits from his business.
He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Safina is hopeful that a loan investment will be more a productive one for him.

loans.use: To buy leather and laces for her husband's shoe making business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is very experienced in pranday making and has decorative embroidery business. She has applied for a loan for her decorative embroidery business that will allow her to make better looking embroidered clothes and increase her sales and profits.
Razia is the mother of three daughters and two sons. Three of them work while her two younger children are getting their education.
Her husband is a laborer by profession and works very hard to support his family.
His income was not enough and that is why Razia started her business to support him financially.
She is confident about her success in business as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy beads, thread, etc for embroidery business.

loans.name: Samphors' Group

texts.en:
Samphors, aged 41, is a married mother of two dependent children (one daughter and one son) who are still in school. Residing in a village of the Thmor Koul district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Samphors also grows rice as the family’s main source of income like other villagers, while her husband is a soldier. She has been in this business to support their living for more than five years. 

There are three members in Samphors’ group. She and other two members have been with VisionFund for five years. Since 2006, the loan has made her live better with sufficient food to eat. She completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. She is now leading this group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Samphors wants to use her loan of KHR1,400,000 to pay for labor to harvest her rice crop and use a portion to pay for combine harvester. This loan will enable her to harvest her rice crops to be ready for sale and daily consumption. She hopes to sell the crops for good profit and set aside some money to afford a bigger house for living and also keep her children in school until they get a higher education.

loans.use: To pay for labor to harvest her rice crop

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en:
Grown up in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Chamroeun is now 48 years old and married. She is a rice farmer who has been farming her own land as a primary business for five years. Duck raising is another source of income. Chamroeun has six sons who are still dependent on her and they works at the family’s farmland and raise ducks to help support the family. With her current business, she earns more than five U.S. dollars per day. 

This is Chamroeun’s group first loan with VisionFund and there are two members in the group. As the leader, she plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland to grow dry season rice. She hopes to make more healthy rice to improve her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Pich 38 is widowed and has two children who are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice on her two-hectare farmland for seven years and in order to earn more income, she grows herbs (a plant used with soup) for sale. 

A leader of the four-member group, Pich is the fifth cycled client with VisionFund while the others have been with VisionFund from two to six years. Since 2006, the loans has helped her to earn better income, afford nutrient food, and buy basic household items. With her current business, she earns around US$4 per day and is able to save around US$3 each day. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to buy fertilizer for her farmland for dry season rice. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to earn a larger income to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Seth's Group

texts.en:
Aged 32 years old, Seth is married and has two dependent children who are still in school. She is a rice farmer and also plants corn as the main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for more than ten years. 

Seth’s group loan consists of three female members and they all have been with VisionFund for three years. Since 2008, the loan has helped Seth make a better living. She has successfully repaid her loans with VisionFund. With good business, she is now leading the group to apply for another loan with VisionFund for US$300 each. As the leader, she will use this entire loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy corn in order to earn a larger income, improve her living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Bovel district of Cambodia, Navy is 36 years old and she is a married mother of three dependent children: one daughter and two sons. Her children now are still in school. She is a rice farmer who has been in this business for almost ten years. In addition to her primary business, she also buys and sells vegetables to earn extra income. 

Navy received a loan from VisionFund two years ago and she successfully repaid the loans with VisionFund. Since 2009, the loan has helped her make a better living and send her children to school regularly. With her current business, she manages to earn more than US$15 per day but is able to save around US$5 each day. With good business, she leads a group of three members in applying for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and also use a portion to buy vegetables for sale. She hopes to increase her business and make more rice to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis has applied for a loan for her husband’s animals selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy sheep, goats and will sell them by growing them up. He will also give them good quality food so that they will become healthier and will be sold for higher profits.
Narigs is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. In her spare time she also supports her husband by giving food to animals.
She has given birth to four children. All of them stay at home as Nargis is unable to afford for their education.
She has confidence about the positive growth of her husband’s business as a result of a loan investment.
Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book (Called Asasah Passbook) is Nargis."

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for her husband's animal sales business

loans.name: Saro's Group

texts.en:
A breadwinner of the family located in a village of the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Saro is a 31 year-old mother of two dependent children who are too young to attend school. Rice farming has been her primary business to make a living for the last six years. To earn more income to better feed her children, Saro raises pigs, chicken, and ducks for sale. With her current business, she earns around US$8 per day and is able to save around US$3 each day. 

Saro’s group loan consists of three members and this is her group’s first loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use this loan to buy more ducks and feeds for her duck. She hopes to feed her ducks to be fat and healthy and also hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Tto buy more ducks and feed.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Srey is 53 years old and married. She has ten children, only three of whom are dependent on her because they are still in school and also work at the family’s business. She grows rice and cassava as the family’s source of income. She has been growing rice and planting cassava for 32 years and ten years, respectively. 

Srey is the second cycled client with VisionFund now. Since 2010, the loan has helped her make a better living. She currently earns more than US$10 per day from her business. Now requesting another loan, she will use this loan to buy a plot of farmland for US$1,000. This loan will enable her to have another plot of land for her cassava business. She hopes to increase her business and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is 35 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. She sells local drinks and has been in this business for eight years and works from 6am until 8pm every day. Nadine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her local drinks to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more quantity of local drinks.

loans.name: Saleang

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Saleang is a 40 year-old mother of two children. One of the children is dependent on her and is still in school. She is a rice farmer of a half hectare of farmland and also plants cassava on 1.5 hectare farmland as her main of income. She has been in this business for almost ten years. In addition, she also makes baskets for sale to better feed her family. With her current business, she earns more than US$5 per day to feed her family. 

Saleang is the first cycled client with VisionFund now. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, she will use this entire loan to buy a plot of farmland for her business. This loan will enable her to have another plot of farmland for rice farming. She hopes to increase her business and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Tto buy materials for latrine construction.

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en:
51 years old, Sroeun is a villager in a village of the Ponhea Krek district. She and her husband Saroem are farmers who plant cassava as a primary business to earn a living. She has been with this business for 25 years. Sometimes, her husband works for others to gain additional income. Sroeun has five children, three of whom are dependents and they are still in school. 

Sroeun started taking a loan with VisionFund two years ago. The loans have helped her have regular income. Now she earns US$10 per day and is able to save more than five U.S. dollars daily. Due to lack of money, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland and use a proportion of the loan to plant soy bean. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price in order to set aside some money to buy one hectare of farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland and plant soy beans.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
A 48 year-old widow in a rural area, Rin is a farmer and has two dependent children who are also farmers. She has struggled to earn a living as a farmer for 32 years. To better feed her children, she also raises chicken at the site. 

Rin leads a group of three female members in the village. She has been with VisionFund for two years. After the loans, her living is now better and she earns around US$2 per day. Now applying for another loan, she will use this loan to pay for others to harvest her rice crops. This loan will enable her to harvest on time and she hopes to earn additional income after harvest.

loans.use: To pay for others to harvest her rice crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old and married with three children. She sells tea and rice to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to expand her business. She hopes to expand her business and be financially stable  in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy utensils, tea leaves and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy utensils, tea leaves and maize flour.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.fr:
Sara est née au Rwanda. Elle a 59 ans et elle est mariée avec 5 enfants de 26 à 32 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Elle a un certificat en tourisme. 

Sara travaille comme agent de l'état. Elle est aussi diacre dans son église. C'est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin de payer les frais universitaires de ses deux enfants qui étudient encore et d'acheter des accessoires scolaires pour eux.

Sara voudrait donner une héritage scolaire à tous ses enfants et assurer qu'ils étudient jusqu'au niveau le plus haut possible.
texts.en:
Sara was born in Rwanda. She is 59 years old and married with 5 children between 26 and 32, 2 of whom attend school. She has a certificate in tourism.
Sara works as a civil servant. She is also a deacon in her church. This is her second loan from ACB. She will use her credit to pay for university fees for the two children who are still studying and to purchase school  materials for them.
Sara wants to give a scholastic legacy to all her children and to make sure that they continue their studies to the highest possible level.

loans.use: to pay university fees and purchase school materials.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.fr:
Freddy a 25 ans et il est célibataire. Il est on train de finir son certificat en gestion.

Freddy est étudiant et il chante dans le chorale de son église. C'est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il a demandé le crédit afin de payer les frais de dépôt de son mémoire académique et de préparer la défense de son mémoire. 

Freddy voudrait devenir un bon manager responsable. Il voudrait se développer et améliorer le bien-être de sa famille. Un jour, il voudrait se marier et être un bon père de famille.
texts.en:
Freddy, age 25, is single. He is a student who is currently completing his management certification. He also sings with his church's choir.

He is seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, in order to pay the fee to submit his academic memoir and prepare its defense.

He would like to become a good and responsible manager. He would also like to develop and improve his family's well-being and, one day, get married and be a good father.

loans.use: to pay the fees to submit his academic memoir and prepare its defense

loans.name: Irabitanga Group

texts.fr:
Floride fait partie du groupe Irabitanga, elle habite à Gitega. Elle  est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à Bernard, vendeur de viande grillée. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants,l’un âgé de 3 ans et l’autre 14 mois.

Elle est  vendeuse de bière de banane depuis 17ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital, afin d’acheter une grande quantité de litres de bière à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle va améliorer sa situation familiale en achetant les habits pour sa famille, en payant les soins médicaux,....
texts.en:
Floride lives in Gitega and belongs to the "Irabitanga" group. She is 39 years old and married to Bernard, who sells grilled meat. They have two children together, one of whom is 3 and the other of whom is 14 months old.

She has sold banana beer for 17 years.

She is on her 11th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she obtains, she is going to increase her capital in order to buy a large quantity of litres of beer for resale, thus earning a higher income.

With the profits, she is going to improve her family's situation by buying clothes for her family, paying for their medical expenses, and so on.

loans.use: To increaser her capital in order to buy a large quantity of beer for resale, thus earning more income.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 47 years old and is a widow. She lives in a village with her three school-age children. Farming is the major source of their income but she also engages in direct selling of Avon, Natasha and MSE products to earn additional income. She has been in this business for almost four years and usually earns a profits of P7,000 a month that she usually spends for the food and allowances of her children. 

She aims to acquire more of the personal products to sell in her village, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional P15,000 to buy lotions, skin softeners, roll ons, body sprays, colognes, leather shoes, blouses, belts and underwear to sell. She mentioned that her loan will help her to improve her business and she is hoping that she will make her business grow and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy lotions, skin softeners, roll ons, body sprays, colognes, leather shoes, blouses, belts and underwear to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
One of the guiding principles of George is that "Time is gold". This principle, pushes him to strive for the best. George is 59 years old and married to Anita. The couple were blessed with four children but all of them have settled for marriage already.

George has been engaged in agricultural business for five years. He is proud that he is a farmer because through his farming business he was able to support his children during their school days. He is thankful because at his age, he still has the strength to do his farming activities. In addition, George still is aiming to increase the number of his crop yield in order to obtain higher income. Since he has wide farm land, he is also in need of bigger capital to provide necessary farm inputs for his rice crop production. With this, he is asking for a loan P50,000. He will use this amount to buy fertilizer, insecticides and some of the loan will be used to pay the irrigation fees for his farmland. He knows that his loan request will have a great impact in making the loan more productive, which will enable him to improve his financial stability and uplift his family out from poverty.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticides and irrigation fees for his farmland.

loans.name: 73-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

 Dung is 34 years old and she is married with three children.  She is the group leader of the 73-Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa Province, and has three dependents.

In 2008, Dung joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Roxanne Joy

texts.en:
As a responsible house wife, Roxanne Joy is engaged in cooking and selling pork and chicken barbecue in her village to supplement her husband's income. She is now 22 years old and has one infant child. With her husband, they plan to improve their sources of income in order to satisfy their necessities and save for the future of their children. 

Despite the high cost of commodities and transportation, Roxanne wants to continue managing the business. Therefore, she is asking for an additional of P8,000 to buy loads of wallets, pork, chicken feet, chicken heads, hot dogs, charcoals, spices and sticks needed in cooking barbecue that she sells in the community. She is hoping that someday, she will see her business grow and her family's status of living will also improve.

loans.use: to buy loads of wallets, pork, chicken feet, chicken heads, hot dogs, charcoals, spices and sticks needed in cooking barbecue for sale.

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is a responsible father, who is engaged in the transportation business using his motorcycle. He has been in this business for over three years. He is now already 42 years old and is married with two children. With his transport motorcycle business, he has been able to receive a net profit of PHP 300 every day.

As of now, Nilo is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy spare parts and gas for the maintenance of his motorcycle. His business has helped him to support his family. He would like to use the profits from this loan to create some savings for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gas for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Fredelito

texts.en:
Fredelito has owned and run his one point five hectare rice field and two hectares of corn since 1976. He is married and he and his wife have been blessed with four grown up children. Three of her children are married while the youngest is still a college student.

Fredelito devotes his time both to his corn and rice field. He is glad that his wife is supportive of the things he is doing, especially farming activities he performs to minimize their expenses. Currently, he is spending a lot due to his children's allowance, tuition fees and other household expenses. The income from his farming business is no longer enough to maintain the land. Soto make his dreams come true, he is asking for additional capital amounting to P35,000. He will use this amount to purchase farm inputs in order to have a plentiful harvest this next crop season. Fredelito, believes that success in life depends on the wise use and management of income and business. He hopes that with the loan he can support his youngest son until the son finish his studies and continue to improve Fredelito's rice crop production.

loans.use: purchase farm inputs for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda is 47, married and has three school age children. Her husband is a farmer and they live harmoniously in a village. Her husband manages their farm lots while Freda manages her small variety store. They plann to continue sending their children to school because they want the children to become professionals in the future. Despite financial difficulties, Freda and her husband help each other gain income to support the education of their children. 

Freda aims to increase her product offerings in her store, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional P15,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, biscuits, junk food, detergent soaps, candies and seasoning for sale. She believes that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, biscuits, junk food, detergent soap, candies and seasoning for sale.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina has been engaged in her motorcycle transport business for five years. She gets a daily income of PHP 600 from the business. Crispina is thankful because she has been blessed with four children who help her to operate her business.
 
Right now, she is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy wheels, oil, and gas for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business and secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy wheels, oil, and gas for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ghafooran's Group

texts.en:
Ghafooran has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her beauty parlor business. She has a lot of talent in her profession and her community ladies come to her salon regularly for makeup and other beauty services.

With the loan investment, she will buy shampoos, creams, and other beauty products in larger quantity to improve her business further. She is confident that by doing this she will also be able to increase her income.

Her husband is a fruit seller and offers fresh quality seasonal fruits to his customers.

Ghafooran has given birth to four children. Her eldest son is a driver while the others stay at home.

She is confident about her business improvement as a result of a loan investment.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, creams, and other beauty products for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 43 years old and married to a farmer. They are blessed with two children and they live happily in a village. Her husband manages their rice farming business while Florence engages in cooking and selling food for meals and snacks in their community. She has been in this business for almost five years. She usually earns a profit of PHP 8,000 a month, which she usually spends for the family’s food and the allowances for their children. 

She aimed to cook and sell more recipes to satisfy her customers’ demand, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 6,000 to buy rice, pork, chicken meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings, and spices needed in her cooking recipes for sale. She believes that someday she will improve the business as she continues to work hard and makes an improvement to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, pork, chicken meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings, and spices needed in cooking recipes for sale.

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Due to the hardship of life, Jacquelyn aims to improve her small variety store to increase her income, satisfy her family’s needs, and finance the education of their four children. Jacquelyn and her husband aim to improve their status of living so that they will educate their children and give them a better life. Despite financial constraints, they have the determination to achieve their goals.

To work out their plan, Jacquelyn is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, junk foods, beverages, and seasonings to sell. She mentioned that her loan will help them to work out their plan and hopes that they will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, junk foods, beverages, and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is proud that he is a farmer. Though he didn't finish his education, he knows how to farm. He thanks Almighty God for giving him the knowledge and strength to run his business well. Alfredo is married, with two children. His wife stays at home to take care of the children and their daily needs.

Alfredo has been a farmer for seven years. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He keeps some of the harvest for his family's daily meals and sells the rest. Alfredo is thankful because his first loan really helped him a lot.

Alfredo is requesting a loan of P20,000 which will be used to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides for his rice production. He hopes that he will obtain higher profits this next crop season to continue to support his children's education and improve their living conditions. In addition, he will save some of the profit for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides for his rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggplant, squash, beans, cabbage, onions, garlic, and fish to sell in the village.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a patient mother. She is married and has three children. Two of them have finished their education and one is still in school studying nursing. Her spouse is her partner in the retail business. She is now asking for a loan to diversify her business. She is asking for P20,000 to buy soft drinks, liquor, biscuits, eggs, and coffee to sell. This will allow her to keep generating income for the education of her youngest child. 

She hopes that someday, all her children will be employed and earn a good living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquor, biscuits, eggs, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine to ensure the proper growth of the pigs she raises.

loans.name: Marvelyn

texts.en:
Marvelyn is a hardworking mother of four. She is 51 years old and a fish vendor at the public market in San Jose. She lives with her spouse, a farmer. Income from her fish-selling business helped her support her children's education. All her children are married now. 

Marvelyn is requesting a loan from ASKI in the amount of P12,000 to buy milkfish, shrimp, and crabs to sell. She would like to increase her income so she can start a hog-raising business to generate more income. She hopes to achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy milkfish, shrimp, and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 40 years old and has one child. She is a vendor selling pork meat to the people in her village. Her stall is located just in front of the house. She is now asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy more pork and beef meat to sell and increase her profits. 

In the future, she would like to establish a larger stall for her to sell her products conveniently and keep up with all her customers' demand for the high quality of meat she sells.

loans.use: to buy more pork and beef meat to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
At the age of 49, Vilma still hopes to renovate her house that was destroyed by a typhoon a couple of months ago. To attain her goal, she helps her spouse to earn an income. Her spouse is into the farming business while she is involved in direct sales. She sells brewed coffee, soap, lotion, shampoo and air freshener offered to the people in their village. She has been in this kind of business for 13 years and aims to diversify it. 

She is now asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy more quantities of soap, lotion, perfume and shampoo to sell to her customers.

With the family's perseverance and hard work, they are confident that someday they will earn income for the house renovation and achieve economic stability, too.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of soap, lotion, perfume and shampoo to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary and her husband, Borin, have been married since 1988 and have three sons and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Theary is a weaver. Her husband is a farmer; he grows bananas and pumpkins. Theary has asked for Kiva loans several times; she now is asking for another loan in the amount of $500 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

In the photo, Theary was not weaving because the credit officer arrived at nearly lunchtime, so Theary was cooking.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Chantheun

texts.en:
Chantheun (in the photo) is 45 years old and her husband; Savet is 44 years old, live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh and have two sons and one daughter. One has full-time employment and another one is a security guard and another one is in school. 

Chantheun and her husband are farmers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to get work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy frozen food, rice, plastic wares, cosmetic items, canned goods, snack food and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Venerable

texts.en:
Venerable has been raising rice  for almost 15 years. He patiently manages his rice farming business because it's his family's main source of income. He is 34 years old and married.

Venerable desires to have a plentiful harvest this season due to many household expenses and expensive farm inputs. He and his wife work together to earn a living. He has a happy family that inspires him to strive hard to be able to acquire greater profits. According to him, his income last crop season was used in paying his obligation to traders who have high interest rates, so his income is no longer enough to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to ensure the growth of his rice crop.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. He hopes to gain additional profit to make his living progressively and to save for the bright future of his only child.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to ensure the growth of his rice crop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Despite the economic crisis, Mary aims to improve her small variety store to cover her family's basic necessities and to support the education of their three children. With the help of her husband, she believes that they can survive poverty and give their children a better life. 

She plans to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand, but due inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 8,000 to buy cosmetics, tupperware, footwear, soft drinks and breads to sell in her store. She believes that the loan will help her to make an improvement in her business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, tupperware, footwear, soft drinks and breads to sell

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s tailoring business. He is an expert in making leather jackets. He receives orders regularly from different factories and shops and he fulfills those orders to earn income for his family. With the loan investment, he will buy leather and thread for making better-quality leather jackets to increase his sales and income.

Rehana is an embroidery expert who receives regular orders every month from ladies in her community who are very impressed with her good-quality work.  Rehana has given birth to 3 daughters and a son. Two of her children are studying while the other 2 are not of school-going age yet.

Rehana is very hopeful that her husband will have good success in his business by making positive use of the loan money. In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy leather and threads for a tailoring business

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Due to hardships and lack of finances, Romeo wasn't able to continue his studies.  Instead he became his father's helper in managing their rice field.  Romeo is a responsible husband and father to his two children. He is thankful because his father taught him the farm techniques  necessary for good production of rice.

Romeo has owned and operated his rice field for almost 20 years.  He would like to perform his farm techniques properly in order to increase his yields this coming crop season.  But he can't, due to shortage of capital.  So, with his determination to obtain a higher profit, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000.   He will be using the loan amount wisely, especially in buying fertilizer, insecticides and other farm supplies needed to improve his crop's growth.  Romeo knows that his sacrifices will give him a fruitful outcome which will enable him to send his children to school and sustain all his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and other farm supplies needed for his rice field

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 34 years old, a very friendly and helpful woman.  She relaxes by helping other people, especially the street children who usually sit in front of her business. Annabelle currently has an auto supply shop in her village. After eight years of operating this business, her family's underprivileged lifestyle was improved. She started doing this business as she began to have her own family.  Before, she was a helper in a restaurant, which she wouldn’t want to experience again. This has caused her to become a hard worker and fascinated by operating her business to avoid an awful life.

Annabelle wants to make good decisions in order to gain high profits. With her chosen business, she is very happy for the support that her husband has given to her. They are working hand in hand to save for their future and the expansion of her business.  Her business brings a good profit which she shares with the street children.
